snippet: Baikonur, Kazakhstan, is set to be replaced as the Russian space launching center, and ethnic tensions and economic challenges are already creeping into the city.
abstract: Baikonur, Kazakhstan, once pride of Soviet Union and center of its space program, is being replaced by eastern city of Vostochny as Russian space launching center; ethnic tensions and economic troubles are creeping into Beikonur as Russia turns its attentions elsewhere, despite fact that United States and several other countries still launch from Baikonur.
lead_paragraph: Baikonur, Kazakhstan, is set to be replaced as the Russian space launching center, and ethnic tensions and economic challenges are already creeping into the city.

headline.main: Russian Space Center in Kazakhstan Counts Down Its Days of Glory
headline.print_headline: Russian Space Center in Kazakhstan Counts Down Its Days of Glory
